meanings.definition: A tenth part of something, especially income, paid as a tax or contribution.
meanings.sent1: The farmer donated a portion of his crops as tythes to the church.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, people still give tythes to support their religious institutions.
meanings.sent3: The tythes from the community helped rebuild the local church after the storm.
meanings.sent4: The tythes of kindness and generosity spread throughout the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The concept of tythes dates back to ancient times, showing the importance of sharing resources.

meanings.definition: To pay or give a tenth part of something, especially income, as a tax or contribution.
meanings.sent1: She tythes a portion of her salary every month to support a charity.
meanings.sent2: The villagers tythes their harvest to ensure the well-being of the entire community.
meanings.sent3: He tythes his time by volunteering at the local shelter every weekend.
meanings.sent4: The company tythes a percentage of its profits to various social causes.
meanings.sent5: Tything not only benefits others but also brings a sense of fulfillment to the giver.
